turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: I'll miss you, Mike.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Listen, I'll... see you again.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I like your coat.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: You have a weakness for Lady Cops.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I do.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Say goodbye, Mike.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You take care.

turns.speaker: GIDDINGS
turns.text: Hello, Claire.  How extraordinary that you came.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: It was something my father always liked me to do.

turns.speaker: GIDDINGS
turns.text: You're planning to speak?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Not if you don't want me to.

turns.speaker: GIDDINGS
turns.text: Well, of course, we'd be... honored...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Just putting in an appearance then.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: ... just saying you should think twice about it...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: ... I don't want to talk about it...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: ... You know, and I know, that the only thing standing between a life sentence for Venza and his freedom is my testimony at his trial...

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Claire...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: ... He killed Win... he enjoyed it...

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Win made his choices, Claire.  We all do --

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: And I'm making mine.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You're dealing with a psychopath. He gets out of jail in ten years, or five... or ninety days, and you'll be looking over your shoulder for the rest of your life...

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: What am I supposed to do?!  I saw one of my oldest friends get killed! And I saw who did it!  I can't just -- "let it go away"!!

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Claire...

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Keep what handy?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: The gun?  It's in the upstairs closet.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: We're not going to the game, are we Mom?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Sure we are, let's go!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Mom, what's going to happen with you and Dad?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I don't know Tommy.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Hey, can we go to McDonald's?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Tommy...!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I'm all right.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Think I should put the skateboard in bed with him?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Too kinky.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Ellie, you know I think it's about time we got outa this place, get us a house of our own.  We can afford it now.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Amen to that.  The supermarket's full of assholes.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Take my advice, don't buy any...

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Mike?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: My ass if falling.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Your what...?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: My ass is falling.  It is.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I just saw it in the mirror, it doesn't look like my ass anymore.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Get in bed.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: What am I gonna do?  I jog, I do the exercises on TV in the morning... gravity...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You got a great ass!  I love your ass -- now get that falling ass into bed before it hits the floor.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Tomorrow, I start looking for our house... You love me?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You got no idea...

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Imagine... I'm sleepin' with a DT.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: So how'd it go?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Not great.  I've got a babysitting job for a material witness on a homicide.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: For how long?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: 'Til they pick up the perp.  Seniority gets day shift... You know what that means.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Don't start... The only reason is that the neighborhood's shi...  ... crummy.  I just don't like the idea of leaving you alone here at night.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I can still use a gun.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Just keep it someplace safe, but handy.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Changing the sparks.  They showed it on TV.  What d'you think?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I think television's a dangerous thing.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: It's twenty bucks in the bank.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hey.  The neighbors.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Let 'em eat their hearts out.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I read the article.  You didn't tell me she was so beautiful.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Well, actually, she looks better than that.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Unbelievably handsome.  You look fantastic in a suit.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: The real estate lady left, she couldn't wait anymore.  What took you?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Oh, some shit.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: What shit, honey?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You don't want to hear about it.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Honey.  You got him.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't know that Ellie.  He might get out.  Garber's not bein' straight with the witness, she could be in deep shit if she identifies him, and it's my job to convince her she won't be.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: She's got to identify him.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Because the the only way to stop crime is to identify criminals.  I can't believe you're talking this way Mister Detective -- I think she's got a lot of guts.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I think -- she's crazy.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I'd identify him.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I might stop you.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Oh I can see you've had a bad day. We'll see the house another time, okay?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No!  No!  I'm sorry.  Ninety-seven five right?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Where'd you get the tie?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Bought it.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: It's not your taste.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What did she say the down payment was?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She didn't like the other one, so she picked this one.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: She took you shopping for a tie?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I had to follow her to a store.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: What's wrong with your paisley tie?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Ellie, it was a formal party...

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Excuse me!  You went to a party with her?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm her bodyguard, goddamnit...

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I know you're her bodyguard.  Did she buy it or did you?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She bought it.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I don't know why she bought me a tie! -- She's a generous person -- and she's a nice person -- and I could be settin' her up to be killed... you want the fuckin' tie?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Coming to bed?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Few minutes.  Want to catch the news.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Should I wait up?  We've got to get up early for the beach tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'll be right up.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Goddamn Venza assaulted a taxi driver in the Bronx, thirteen months ago.  It's coming to court and the judge let him walk because of the pending case law.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Mike, take it easy...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Take it easy!  I set her up.  I saw it coming.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: It's not your fault.  Mike, please get off the case.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It is my fault!  I'm responsible for her!

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Did you hear what I said?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Did you hear what I said?!!

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I know I heard noises... the detective's wife...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I want you and Tommy to stay with my mother.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: C'mon, don't make an issue of it. Do you want the fucking meatloaf or not?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: D'you have to say "fucking" every other word?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You heard me.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Jesus, Mike, somebody's been feeding you a line of crap.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What're you talking about --

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I'm talking about I've been talking this way for sixteen years and now, out of the blue, it's vulgar!

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: You gotta get another tour.  We're gettin' too old for this.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I'm not saying it's your fault.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What did you do tonight?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I watched TV.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What did you watch?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I don't remember Michael, go to sleep.  You don't have to make conversation with me.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Hey, we qualify for the Senior Citizens Early-Bird Special... Did you see Tommy today?  He misses you...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Well.  This'll be over soon. Venza's such a nut job, we're bound to pick him up soon.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I'd like you to switch to the day shift, Mike.  To be home for dinner. Helen insists that T.J. be home for dinner... That's why he's on the morning shift.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Well, T.J.'s... seniority... and all.  I'll talk to Garber about it.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I already did.  I mean, I talked to his wife, and she talked to him...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You talked to his wife?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: My wife talks to his wife about what shift I'm gonna take?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: What's the difference?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Let me drive...

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Get away from me... get away!  She means that much to you, you stay with her.  But you come back, you come back for me.  Not for Tommy, not for your mother, or your fucking job, but for me.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: El?  I'm sorry.  I do love you.  And you are a lady.  I have so much respect...

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I'm going to visit my sister for a few days.  I'd like you to get your stuff out.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What about Tommy?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: He'll live through it.  They all live through it.  What a world, huh?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Was it Venza?  Did you get him?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Ellie...

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: I'm all right.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: He doesn't want to sleep here.  Neither do I.  It's not my house anymore.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Me neither.

turns.speaker: GARBER
turns.text: I don't know how you did it, but whatever it was, keep doing it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I just sat and listened.

turns.speaker: GARBER
turns.text: Safe and secure is how we want her. Until she I.D.'s Venza.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Why not Patrol?  They'd do just as good a job.

turns.speaker: GARBER
turns.text: When I want your advise, Keegan, I'll make an appointment.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What about when she goes out?

turns.speaker: GARBER
turns.text: Discourage it.  But stay with her if you can't.  Call it in first so we can have a car on tail.  She's agreed to travel only with her own driver and limousine... okay, let's check it out.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: But I got him!  He's in jail! Wasn't that the point...?!

turns.speaker: GARBER
turns.text: You apprehended him after he gave himself up --

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It wasn't a bad bust.  He gave himself up because he knew I was gonna nab him.

turns.speaker: GARBER
turns.text: Anyone who turns himself in makes a good case for bail.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Even Joey Venza?!

turns.speaker: GARBER
turns.text: He's got a good lawyer, and he made a smart move.  We've got a scared witness and a suspect who proved "good will" by turning himself in.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What about when she identifies him?!

turns.speaker: GARBER
turns.text: If she identifies him.  Where the fuck were you anyway, cowboy!  Venza was meat.  He walked right past you, and now we're the ones playing catch-up!  You better hope she identifies him.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: They're operating on him.  He's still alive.

turns.speaker: GARBER
turns.text: I heard.

turns.speaker: GARBER
turns.text: I heard a lot... Anything you want to deny, Mike?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It should've been me...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What do you think?  Any chance?  There's nothin' else I'm any good at, but this.

turns.speaker: GARBER
turns.text: Call me next week.  We'll talk about it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: At my house...!

turns.speaker: KOONTZ
turns.text: Call a cruiser!

turns.speaker: KOONTZ
turns.text: Let's go.  We're takin' her home!  Move it!  Get the cars!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Koontz!  I need you guys!

turns.speaker: KOONTZ
turns.text: We'll call SWAT.  We'll get the locals.  Throw it!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No, I need'm now!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No One-Seventeen, they'll fuck it up!  He told me not to tell anybody, to bring Claire and come alone!  He won't wait, he knows I'm two minutes away!  Koontz, please!

turns.speaker: KOONTZ
turns.text: I can't do it, you know that... He's not gonna allow it anyway, Mike.  No way is he gonna let anybody walk out of that house alive, who can finger him.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Hey Mike, out of the bag into the bureau, huh... How do you like it so far?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Right behind you, T.J.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Who's Joey Venza?

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Bad fuckin' news.  Even the families dropped him when they found they had a fruitcake on their hands.  But he knows where a lot of bodies are buried.  It'd cap it for Garber if he could bring him in.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Shit!  A Nursemaid!  My first detail, and I'm a fuckin' slug!  I got a 'choice' at all.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Do it, or look for another profession.  That's a choice I guess.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: You in this with me?

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Yeah!  Seniority gets the day shift.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Not Koontz.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Be happy.  He's good at this.

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Wasn't your fault.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: It was my fault, T.J.  Fuck!

turns.speaker: T.J.
turns.text: Tell me I'm dreamin'.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I just gotta talk to her, T.J.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Uh, yeah.  I'm a policeman.

turns.speaker: PRETTY YOUNG THING
turns.text: Ever shot anyone?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PRETTY YOUNG THING
turns.text: Does it make you... hard?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: ... Hard?

turns.speaker: PRETTY YOUNG THING
turns.text: Erect.  You know, a "boner?"  I'd heard that it gives you a boner, to shoot a man.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Are you in charge here?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No, sir...

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I asked for the man in charge...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That would be Lieutenant Garber, and he's very busy upstairs...

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: Don't tell me he's "busy".  I asked for an ambulance for this woman and...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Is she injured?

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You're not going to talk to anyone without a lawyer.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She's not a suspect, sir, she's a witness.  Could I ask you to step outside, please.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: No, I will not step outside.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Sir, I am just trying to do my job, it's standard procedure to question the witness alone.  Help me out here, could you please leave.

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: I don't really see what that has to do with...

turns.speaker: NEIL
turns.text: You're here 'til what time?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'm relieved at 4:00 A.M.

turns.speaker: VENZA
turns.text: You made a terrible mistake, Keegan. You didn't do what I said.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: That's right, you're gonna do what I say.  Joey.  I want to help you out of this.

turns.speaker: VENZA
turns.text: You should'a brought the girl.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I brought the girl.  She's outside.

turns.speaker: VENZA
turns.text: Hold it...!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'll prove it!

turns.speaker: VENZA
turns.text: How do I know that's her?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'll bring her in.  You let them go, and I'll bring her in.

turns.speaker: VENZA
turns.text: Why should she come in?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She trusts me.  She'll do what I say.

turns.speaker: VENZA
turns.text: Bullshit!  Prove it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Koontz!  Let her come in!  Claire! It's pitch dark in here!  You're gonna have trouble seeing anything, so just come in, and straight down a long hall.  Then stand at the door so we can see you. We want to see your face and we won't be able to until you get to the kitchen door!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I want your guarantee they'll be turned loose when she opens the front door.

turns.speaker: VENZA
turns.text: I get my hostage first.  No one's turned loose until I say so.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Let my kid go.

turns.speaker: VENZA
turns.text: I'm not lettin' no one go.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Get that gun away from his head, or I'll keep her from coming in!  Put the gun on me, he can't hurt you! He's tied up!  Put him under the table!

turns.speaker: VENZA
turns.text: Don't you fuckin' give orders to me...

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Put him under the table or I'll stop her from coming in.

turns.speaker: VENZA
turns.text: Under the table.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I'll take his place, all right?  Put the gun to my head.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Watch your step!

turns.speaker: VENZA
turns.text: What the fuck you doin'?!

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: What're we having?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: My special, scrambled eggs surprise.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Scrambled eggs surprise?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: How do you know where the gun is?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I know where everything is.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Except the goddamn skateboards, which are everywhere!  I'd like to kill the guy who invented those things.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Lay back, Mack.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Lay back, Mack!!  What's this "lay back, Mack?"  Where does he get this?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: God!  Scrambled eggs surprise?! These are pickles...!  God!

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Just "lay back, Mack"... lay back...

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Nice threads Dad.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Yeah, I think so.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: How are things going, pal?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Okay, I guess.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: How about dinner tonight?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Mom and I got plans.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What "plans?"  You and Mom got "plans?"

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: She's taking singing lessons.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: She's what?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: She met some friend of Aunt Millie's who works for a record company.  He thinks she's got a great voice.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: What!  What kind of pathetic line is that?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: We're gonna pass the street.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: You coming in?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No, I'm not coming in.  And if you'd rather go to a "singing lesson" than have dinner with your father...

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: We're not going to a singing lesson, she's just gonna start taking singing lessons.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: So, what are you doing tonight?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Shooting.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Shooting?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Yeah.  She says we gotta get used to being alone in this neighborhood.  'Bye, Dad.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Tommy!  The guy's a sleaze-bag.  She can't sing.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I don't think she can sing, either.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Take care, pal.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Sexual tension...

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Oh, beware of jealousy, my lord, the green-eyed monster...

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Time to get my bowling ball re drilled.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Peter Parker, you have no idea what I did this weekend.  Or didn't do. It's no business of yours either way.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Well, look who's dressing for success.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: At least this ensemble doesn't glow in the dark.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: And Flash isn't?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Be nice.

turns.speaker: ADELE
turns.text: Peter-- you took this picture?

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Let me see.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Here you go, Pete.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Uh, Uncle Ben, I--

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: What, want a glass?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No. No, that's okay.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: So, uh... how's college goin'?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Same old stuff.  How's the pharmacy?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Ah, ya know.  Neighborhood's not what it used to be.  Kid no more'n five swiped a candy bar the other day.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You stop him?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Wasn't worth gettin' upset over a Milky Way.  Anyways, I was never much for, ya know, discipline.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I know.  Still thinking about retiring?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Eh.  If I ever get out from under. Maybe take May to France or somethin'.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Ya still follow the Mets, Pete?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Nonot really.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: S'funny.  When your mom and dad, uh, passed away, I had this idea. I wanted you to be the best baseball player in the world.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Remember Little League?

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yeah, Babe Ruth you wasn't.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Ya set for, uh, ya know-- money?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, sure.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Cause if you get in a bind--

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No, no.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yeah, ya like to do things on your own  I been thinkin' lately.  Maybe I wasn't the, ya know, greatest dad--

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, come on, Ben ,that's not--

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: -- no, I mean... we... your Aunt May not wantin' kids and all... I mean we both...

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: When you won that scholarship, I was proud of you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I'm always here, Pete.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah, take pity on the feeble minded.

turns.speaker: FLASH
turns.text: No, no, listen. They're tryin' to say he was in cahoots with this killer--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Flash, drop it--

turns.speaker: FLASH
turns.text: -- but they got it all wrong.  Any fool can figure it out.  Spider-Man nailed this guy!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I was there.

turns.speaker: FLASH
turns.text: See?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Or was it all a dream?

turns.speaker: FLASH
turns.text: Lizzy!

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I was sort of hoping to get out of--

turns.speaker: FLASH
turns.text: I'm parked illegally!

turns.speaker: FLASH
turns.text: Hey, guys.  Check it out-- I saw this dud on the tube last night. He is incredibly cool.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: I saw him too.  He was silly and obnoxious.

turns.speaker: FLASH
turns.text: Mistake?  Hey, guy, get back here!

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Hm.  What a lump.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Flash, get lost.

turns.speaker: FLASH
turns.text: Come on, laughter's the best medicine!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You maniac.  You'll blow your scholarship.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: They'll never take me alive.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What's in there?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: A little bunny I saved from dissection.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Harry!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ooooh.  Your feet are on fire.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Harry

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: "Harry Osborne diminishes the stature of the University."

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Let me guess.  The hunting dogs. You lost your scholarship.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: "Scholarship students must maintain dignity at all times."

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I know.  I've got one too.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Screw scholarships!   Universities are death!  They make slaves of us all with their fetid ideas!  Burn 'em down, I say!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Great idea.  Let me get some shoes. I'll take you home.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Why home? The real world beckons, man!  The possibilities are endless.  Want to go up to the World Trade Center and laugh at New Jersey?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're so responsible it's disgusting. But you're my only friend... do you hate me?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Don't be pitiful.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I am not pitiful!  I am the bridge to the Übermensch!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Jesus Christ.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And you let me go on about Rosomoff working me too hard?  I feel like a complete idiot.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You're not half the idiot I am, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You get mugged or something?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Listen, I do appreciate your concern, but--

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I got you a present.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh, I need your notes from the classes I missed.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Well, I've missed a lot of classes myself...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh. Well, hang in there, amigo.
